intro: Potentilla visianii, commonly known as the visianii cinquefoil, is a perennial shrub native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and has compound leaves with five to seven leaflets. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in alpine and subalpine habitats. Due to its ornamental value and hardy nature, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and rockeries.
